title: Power Rangers to feature lesbian superhero
text:
Power Rangers to feature lesbian superhero Alexandra Klausner, New York Post, News Corp Australia Network March 21, 2017 4:04am 
GO, Go gay Power Ranger! 
â€œPower Rangers,â€ the Lionsgate reboot of the popular kids TV show, will debut its first openly gay action hero when it opens in theatres nationwide on Thursday. 
Yellow Power Ranger Trini, played by actor Becky G., questions her sexuality in the film â€” a plot point director Dean Israelite hopes will resonate with a younger audience, reports the New York Post . A post shared by Becky G. Updates ğŸ’› (@beckyguptodate) on Mar 20, 2017 at 12:34am PDT 
â€œFor Trini, really sheâ€™s questioning a lot about who she is,â€ the director told Hollywood Reporter. 
â€œShe hasnâ€™t fully figured it out yet. I think whatâ€™s great about that scene and what that scene propels for the rest of the movie is, â€˜Thatâ€™s OK.â€™ The movie is saying, â€˜Thatâ€™s OK,â€™ and all of the kids have to own who they are and find their tribe.â€ A post shared by Becky G. Updates ğŸ’› (@beckyguptodate) on Mar 20, 2017 at 12:31am PDT 
The original yellow Power Ranger in the 1990s TV series, played by actor Thuy Trang, was straight. 
The superhero film is not the first big-budget remake to debut a gay character. media_camera Becky G. and Elizabeth Banks in a scene from film Power Rangers. Picture: Supplied. 
Over the weekend, â€œBeauty and the Beastâ€ introduced Disneyâ€™s first openly gay character, LeFou, played by actor Josh Gad.
